Blister Blight.description: Caused by Exobasidium vexans fungus. White to pink blisters appear on young leaves, turning brown as they age.
treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides like Bordeaux mixture
Improve air circulation by proper pruning
Avoid overhead irrigation during wet weather

Brown Blight.description: Caused by Colletotrichum camelliae. Brown necrotic patches appear on mature leaves, often with concentric rings.
treatment: Maintain proper drainage in tea fields

Gray Blight.description: Caused by Pestalotiopsis species. Gray spots with dark margins appear on leaves, leading to defoliation.

Healthy.description: The tea leaf is healthy with no signs of disease. Good dark green color with proper texture.
treatment: Continue regular monitoring for early disease detection

Red Rust.description: Caused by Cephaleuros parasiticus algae. Orange-red rusty patches appear on upper leaf surface.
